name: Vietnamese Kabocha Squash/Pumpkin Soup with Minced Shrimp (Canh Bí Đỏ Nấu Tôm Băm)
description: A classic and simple Vietnamese kabocha squash or pumpkin soup with minced shrimp. A hearty soup that's perfect for the fall and winter months.
keywords: Vietnamese pumpkin soup, Vietnamese kabocha squash soup, Vietnamese kabocha squash soup with shrimp, Vietnamese kabocha squash soup with minced shrimp, kabocha soup recipe, Asian kabocha soup recipe, kabocha soup with shrimp, pumpkin soup with shrimp recipe, Asian pumpkin soup recipe with shrimp, canh bi do nau tom bam, canh bi do nau tom, canh bi do, canh bí đỏ nấu tôm băm, Vietnamese canh recipe, Vietnamese soup recipe, Vietnamese kabocha soup, Vietnamese kabocha soup recipe, Vietnamese shrimp recipe, Vietnamese soups, canh bi recipe, pumpkin soup recipe with shrimp, pumpkin soup recipe

video.name: Vietnamese Kabocha Squash/Pumpkin Soup with Minced Shrimp (Canh Bí Đỏ Nấu Tôm Băm)
video.description: A classic and simple Vietnamese kabocha squash or pumpkin soup with minced shrimp. A hearty soup that's perfect for the fall and winter months.

recipeIngredient: 10 large shrimp (size 21-25; peel, devein; finely mince into paste)
recipeInstructions: In a medium bowl, mix shrimp paste with whites of green onions, half of the garlic, salt, sugar, chicken bouillon powder, and ground black pepper. Set aside.

Cut the kabocha squash in half. Remove the seeds with a large metal spoon. Cut the kabocha flesh into 1-inch cubes. I like to leave the skin on, which tastes amazing, but you can cut it away if preferred.
In a medium pot, heat oil on medium-high. Add remaining garlic and saute until fragrant (about 20 seconds). Add water/stock. Bring the pot to a boil.
Add cubed kabocha squash and cook on a low simmer for 10 minutes.

Scoop shrimp paste into small balls and drop directly into the pot. Continue to cook for 5 more minutes on a low simmer or until kabocha squash is chopstick-tender and shrimp balls are floating, which indicates that they are cooked through.
Season to taste with salt, sugar, chicken/mushroom bouillon powder, and fish sauce. When ready to serve, garnish with the green part of green onions/scallions and a sprinkle of ground black pepper.
